page.title: 14The W.I's view of Singleton
page.content: The Women's Institute is basically a united party of women,who aim to improve the position of women in society.The English section of the W.I. was founded in Charlton,near West Dean,in November,1915. The area covered by Singleton(and West Dean) is approx. 3 square miles.There are two farms in the area,the largest being Manor Farm,which recently sold its entire stock of dairy cattle,in favour of cereal farming. The highest hill in the area is St. Roche's hill,which is topped by the triangulation point(206 metres above sea level). There is one school in Singleton,and one in West Dean. The two villages can be reached via the A286,Town Lane and Charlton Road.
